meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Liz Miles Kelly Bayles Tim Mercure Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7313.

td.p: Liz Miles, a doctoral candidate in anthropology from New Haven, Connecticut
Kelly Bayles, a librarian from Tulsa, Oklahoma
Tim Mercure, a graduate student in mathematics from Washington, D.C. (whose 1-day cash winnings total $20,401)

tr.td: NAME'S THE SAME
"UCK"Y STUFF
IVY LEAGUE
THE MOVIE ACTOR'S ROLE
PRESIDENTS FROM OHIO
GEOGRAPHY IN RHYME
(Alex: You have to identify the country for us.)

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex: [To Tim] Let\'s take a look at your response to this team sport. You said, "What is javelin?" I see. I throw, you catch. No, that\'s wrong.)
TimWhat is javelin?
$2,601
LizWhat is fencing?
$3,000
KellyWhat is javelin?
$0
rowing')

The USA's first intercollegiate athletic event was in 1852 in this, which as a sport goes back to at least the Middle Ages
Tim
Kelly
Liz
3rd place: $1,000
New champion: $16,900
2nd place: $2,000
Tim
Kelly
Liz

16 R,
5 W
(including 1 DD)

18 R
(including 2 DDs),
2 W
